summary: adenoviruses (AdVs) are double-stranded DNA viruses with a nonenveloped icosahedral capsid, 60 to 100 nm in size, and a genome of 26 to 45 kb. they have a wide host range among vertebrates, including human and nonhuman primates (1–4) a novel BtAdV, BtAdV-TJM, was isolated from myotis davidii (2). this is the first genome-wide profile of BtAdV in its host across 5 time points. unique transcriptional features of BtAdV were revealed by quantitative PCR. RNA was extracted using the RNeasy minikit according to the manufacturer's protocol (Qiagen) first-strand cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer primer and reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen) the second-strand cDNA was synthesized using a random hexamer primer and reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen) PCR was performed using the cDNAs transcribed from the infected cells at 18 h p.i. with different sets of primers located within predicted exons of E1A, IVa-2, pol, E4 6/7, pTP, and 33K. PCR products shorter than those expected from unspliced mRNA were exact from agarose gel and sequenced with the specific primers. quantitative real-time PCR (qRT-PCR) was performed on the same sets of RNA samples which had been used in the RNA-seq analysis. qRT-PCR primers of target genes were designed using Primer Express 3.0 (Applied Biosystems) 1 g total RNA from each time point was reverse transcribed using the QuantiTect reverse transcription kit (Qiagen) and used for qPCR. RNA was extracted from infected cells at 0, 6, 8, 12, and 18 h p.i. mRNA was fragmented by addition of 5 fragmentation buffer. cDNA was synthesized using random hexamer primer and reverse transcriptase. PCR was performed using the cDNAs transcribed from the infected cells at 18 h p.i. with different sets of primers located within predicted exons of E1A, IVa-2, pol, E4 6/7, pTP, and 33K. no more than three nucleotide mismatches allowed. TTTTAGCAGAGAGCGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG quantitative real-time qPCR was performed on the same sets of RNA samples used in the RNA-seq experiments. qRT-PCR primers of target genes were designed using Primer Express 3.0 (Applied Biosystems) in brief, 1 g total RNA from each time point was reverse transcribed using the QuantiTect reverse transcription kit. at 18 h p.i., the viral reads mapped to 95% of the nucleotides of both strands of the BtAdV genome. the number of reads was found to be unevenly distributed among the viral genes, reflecting huge differences in gene expression levels. cluster 1 included 15 genes that were expressed immediately after the infection, 9 of which were remarkable as their expression peaked at 6 h p.i. the expression of the other 6 genes in this cluster continued to increase from 0 h to 18 h p.i. most of the cluster 1 genes were located at the right terminus of the upper and lower strand of the genome. gene expression profiles of the BtAdV were similar to those of human AdV type 2. genes in cluster 1 corresponded to human AdV type 2 homologs involved in viral transcription and replication. gene expression profiles are plotted and represent three main replication stages. minor differences were detected at the splicing sites of E1A and 33K by RNA-seq and RT-PCR. the accuracy of the E1A gene splice site prediction by RNA-seq is shown in Fig. 3. the program detected an 8-nt consensus sequence. it is an important promoter signature and required for efficient transcription of AdV type 2 (27) three early genes, E1A, IVa-2, and 100K, two intermediate genes, pTP and 33K, and two late genes, hexon and penton, were tested by qPCR. qPCR data were mostly consistent with those of RNA-seq. mRNA expression levels of viral genes determined by RNA-seq analysis. solid squares indicate mRNA expression levels of viral genes determined by qRT-PCR. qRT-PCR was normalized against the housekeeping gene GAPDH. cellular genes involved in transcription, replication, and translation were upregulated. from 12 to 18 h p.i., the numbers of the upregulated and downregulated cellular genes were significantly increased and finally peaked at 18 h. the most conspicuous change was the downregulation of a large number of genes associated with intra- and extracellular structure. mRNA from 0.01% at 6 h, 0.04% at 8 h, and 0.27% at 12 h to 1.3% at 18 h and a gradual decrease in the cellular mRNA. at 18 h p.i., the viral reads mapped to 95% of the nucleotides of both strands of the BtAdV genome, demonstrating the rapid replication of BtAdV in BK cells. cluster 2 genes were expressed from 6 h p.i., their expression levels peaked at 8 h p.i. and their expression continued to increase through to 18 h p.i. pTP, U exon, 22K, 33K, and IX genes were located proximal to the terminus of the upper and lower strand of the genome. genes in cluster 1 corresponded to the human AdV type 2 homologs involved in viral transcription and replication. genes in cluster 3 corresponded to the human AdV type 2 homologs that were involved in the viral structural proteins and participate in virus assembly. the accuracy of the splice site prediction by RNA-seq is shown in Fig. 3. BtAdV splice sites were verified by RT-PCR gene bioinformatics prediction (nt ranges) core promoter sequences of BtAdV genes Gene Temporal expressiona Strandb Start site (nt)c Predicted promoter core sequenced P valuee E1A E 34 AAAGAGAA 5.08E05 E4ORF6/7 E + 46 AAACAAAA 2.20E05 E4ORFC E + 134 AAAGAAAA 7.81E06 E4ORFD E + 9 AAAGACAA 1.88E04 E4ORFA E + 42 ATAAACAA 1.26E three early genes, E1A, IVa-2, and 100K, two intermediate genes, pTP and 33K, and two late genes, hexon and penton, were tested by qPCR. qPCR data were mostly consistent with those of RNA-seq. all data generated by qRT-PCR were normalized against the housekeeping gene GAPDH. 1,969 bat genes were identified to be differentially expressed by more than 2-fold in BtAdV-infected cells compared to values in uninfected cells. the number of upregulated and downregulated cellular genes was significantly increased from 12 to 18 h p.i. the most conspicuous change was the downregulation of a large number of genes associated with intra- and extracellular structure. the development of the next-generation sequencing techniques has allowed fast and high-throughput sequencing of genomes. the transcription profiles of the seven BtAdV genes differed from those of human AdV type 2. the IVa-2 gene that was not present at 6 h p.i. in human AdV type 2 was highly expressed in BtAdV at 6 h p.i. the pTP protein, which functions as a protein primer for initiation of DNA replication, was expressed at 8 h p.i. in BtAdV and clustered as an intermediate gene mRNA levels may be affected by mutations present on BtAdV genes. expression values obtained by RNA-seq may be affected by mutations present on BtAdV genes. reads with high mutation rates might not be detected during mapping analysis. interleukin 1 alpha and interleukin 8 were suppressed following viral infection. only one proinflammatory cytokine and a cytokine receptor, interleukin 15 and interleukin 4 receptor, respectively, were upregulated at 18 h p.i.
